newsitem.title: FRANCE: RUGBY UNION-FRANCE OVERLOOK CABANNES AND BENEZECH.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-FRANCE OVERLOOK CABANNES AND BENEZECH.

text.p: Flanker Laurent Cabannes and prop Laurent Benezech, in fine form for their English club Harlequins, have been overlooked by France for the first test against the Springboks later this month.
Neither player was among a squad of 26 announced on Tuesday by the French selectors to prepare for the first test in Bordeaux on November 30.
The selectors did not rule out changes in the squad for the second test against South Africa in Paris on December 7, but it is unlikely they would reconsider their stand on either player.
"We did not feel the need to include Benezech," said team manager Jo Maso, who added that other props and notably Franck Tournaire and Christian Califano were preferred.
Of Cabannes, coach Jean-Clause Skrela said: "Lolo is already 32 and as those in charge we have to set ourselves medium and short term goals, which explains why he has been left out."
